What are my patient rights?
As a patient, you have rights regardless of your sex, economic status, educational background, race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or the source of payment for care. Reasonable continuity of care and knowing in advance the time and location of appointments as well as the identity of persons providing the care. 11. Being informed of continuing healthcare requirements following discharge from the hospital. 12. Examining and receiving an explanation of the bill regardless of source of payment. 13. Knowing which hospital rules and policies apply to your conduct while a patient. 14. Having all of your rights apply to the person who may have legal responsibility to make decisions regarding medical care on your behalf. 15. Designating visitors of your choosing, if you have decision making capacity, whether or not the visitor is related by blood or marriage. 16. Having your wishes considered for purposes of determining who may visit if you lack decision making capacity. 17. Being free from seclusion and restraints used in behavior management unless clinically necessary.
